post.description: For filters description, see create interface
For filters description, see create interface
For filters description, see create interface

- This API only supports authentication through shared integration's integration_key. The integration_key can be obtained from integration details; integration_key from dedicated integrations under channels cannot call this API.
- This API is used for monitoring tools to directly get channel list through integration key, filter and specify channels when configuring alert rules, configure alert target channels, without needing to configure routing rules in Flashduty, thus simplifying alert notification configuration.
- This API returns all channel names by default, including those set to private. Please save integration_key carefully to prevent leakage. If member information is passed, member-visible information will be returned first.

Example: specifying ('datacenter' IN ['bj01','sh-*','']) AND ('host' IN '/api-server-\d+/') can match alert events from 'bj01', 'sh-01', 'sh-02' data centers and hostname matching 'api-server-\d+' regex

start_time.title: Start Timestamp
start_time.description: This time is query's start_time, independent of alert's start_time. Actual search condition is: alert.start_time<=query.end_time and alert.last_time>=query.start_time

end_time.title: End Time
end_time.description: This time is query's end_time, independent of alert's end_time. Actual search condition is: alert.start_time<=query.end_time and alert.last_time>=query.start_time

search_after_ctx.description: Cursor pagination, presence of this item indicates next page exists. For detailed explanation, see [About Pagination](https://developer.flashcat.cloud/doc-3502603)

total.description: Total matched count. Note that total is only accurate when less than 1000. Do not use this value to determine if pagination is complete. When total count exceeds 1000, system only returns total=1000, indicating 1000+ data matched. Use hax_next_page to determine if more data exists. For detailed explanation, see [About Pagination](https://developer.flashcat.cloud/doc-3502603)

total_notifications.title: Total notifications
total_notifications.description: Count assignment notifications from all channels

total_interruptions.title: Total interruptions
total_interruptions.description: Only count assignment notifications from SMS, voice, and APP push channels. Multi-channel simultaneous push to one responder counts as one interruption, if less than 1 minute from last notification, does not count as interruption. e.g.: incident assigned at 10:00, continuous notifications for next 5 minutes only count as one interruption

ts.title: Phase start time
ts.description: Second timestamp, whether to display depends on whether data is aggregated by time granularity. If aggregate_unit is day, this value will be determined as midnight timestamp of the day according to time_zone

hours.title: Time type
hours.description: Define each hour as one of work time, rest time, or sleep time. To distinguish metric differences under different time periods. This field is not displayed when time period filtering is not performed. An incident's time type only depends on its occurrence time, even if the incident alive time spans multiple time types, it will not be split.

sql.description:
Standard SQL, but with following limitations:
1. Only supports query statements, and only single table queries
2. Does not support qualifier for table or field
3. Function fields must set alias
4. When format=table and limit is not specified, limit defaults to 1226
5. When both offset and limit are specified, their sum should be less than or equal to 10000
6. Currently query table name only supports sessions/views/actions/errors/long_tasks/resources/vitals/issues/sourcemaps

dql.description:
Optional query condition, used to simplify filtering, this part will be appended to SQL where condition. Example:
sql: "select view_name from views order by event time"
dql: "login"
Actual query: "select view_name from views where  match_any(message, 'login') order by event time;"

interval.description:
Valid when format=time_series, suggested minimum interval milliseconds, actual interval (in response) may not be same as this value, specific calculation logic:
1. Calculate total time range (et - st)
2. Verify time range and max points are valid (both must be > 0)
3. Calculate minimum required interval: (et - st) / max_points
4. Compare calculated minimum interval with suggested interval, take larger value
5. Adjust interval to one of predefined "reasonable" time intervals:
    - Millisecond level: 1, 2, 5, 10, 20, 50, 100, 200, 500 milliseconds
    - Second level: 1, 2, 5, 10, 15, 30, 60 seconds
    - Minute to hour: 2, 5, 10, 15, 30 minutes, 1 hour
    - Hour level: 2, 3, 6, 12 hours
    - Day to week: 1, 2, 3, 7 days
    - Month level: 30, 60, 90, 180 days
6. If required interval exceeds predefined maximum, increment by multiples of 30 days (one month)

max_points.description: Valid when format=time_series, this parameter controls granularity of returned data. Smaller max_points value leads to larger time interval, reducing number of returned data points, suitable for long time range overview. Larger max_points value produces smaller time interval, providing finer-grained data view.

time_zone.description: Valid when format=time_series, specify timezone for time series data segmentation, defaults to UTC timezone. Must use IANA timezone database name, otherwise cannot be parsed.

search_after_ctx.description:
Next page query cursor.

---

Cursor will only be generated when SQL meets following conditions

1. SQL must specify limit parameter
2. SQL cannot specify offset parameter
3. SQL must specify sort field
4. SQL cannot do aggregation query, i.e. does not include COUNT/SUM/Group by logic

Otherwise you need to implement traditional pagination query through limit offset parameters yourself.

---

Note:
To ensure stability of pagination query, you must ensure uniqueness of sort field (usually achieved by adding tiebreaker field), otherwise your query may lose data

Example: Paginated query session list
sql: select * from sessions order by event_time desc, session_id asc;
If only using event_time descending, cannot guarantee uniqueness, but adding tiebreaker field session_id can guarantee uniqueness.

escalate_rule_id.description: (Rule assignment) Escalation rule ID, when exists, choose one between this and person_ids

layer_idx.description: (Rule assignment) Current assignment level, when using rule assignment, can specify the assignment level, e.g. directly escalate to second level

responders.description: Responder list. This value has no absolute relationship with assigned_to, this value may be updated when personnel directly acknowledge or close incident. This personnel list may contain more than assigned_to personnel list

description.description: Incident description, may be plain text, markdown or html type

num.description: Short identifier, may be duplicate, only for quick identification

labels.description: Label information, kv, represents different dimensional information of incident, extracted from integration reported content

dedup_key.description: Incident deduplication key, alert_key of the first alert in incident aggregation

ever_muted.description: Whether flapping reminder/snoozed, such incidents will not be counted in analytics

frequency.description: Trigger frequency. If rare, represents occurring only once within 30 days. If frequent, represents occurring at least 20 times within 30 days

description.description: Alert description, may be plain text, markdown or html

alert_key.description: Event association basis. Alert events with same alert_key will be merged into same alert

alert_status.description: Alert status, note capital first letter. From source monitoring system, automatically changed

start_time.description: Trigger timestamp, in seconds.

last_time.description: Last merged event timestamp, in seconds. Only updated when new alert event is merged, different from updated_at

end_time.description: Alert end timestamp, in seconds. Updated when alert recovers. Auto-recovery will automatically close alert and update close_time simultaneously

created_at.description: Created timestamp, in seconds. Database record creation time, usually equals start_time

updated_at.description: Updated timestamp, in seconds. Database record update time, different from last_time, this field is updated for both manual and automatic alert updates

labels.description: Label list

event_status.description: Event status, note capital first letter

event_severity.description: Event severity, note capital first letter

labels.description: Label
Label

cases.description: Branch aggregation dimensions, only exists when aggregating by rule. Match branch conditions from top to bottom, use branch dimensions for aggregation when matched

items.description: OR relationship between sets, AND relationship within set

equals.description: Default aggregation dimensions, only exists when aggregating by rule. If all branches do not match, use this dimension as fallback. Note this dimension is multiple groups of aggregation dimensions, alerts are aggregated if any group of dimensions is satisfied

all_equals_required.description: Whether all equal items need to exist. Only exists when aggregating by rule. Defaults to false. Difference when configuring multiple equal items: - When enabled, aggregation conditions where values are empty in both alert and incident are treated as different items. - When disabled, aggregation conditions where values are empty in both alert and incident are treated as equal items.

time_window.description: Time window, in minutes, range [0,60]. 0 means keep merging alerts until incident is closed

storm_threshold.description: Storm threshold, storm warning when aggregated alert count exceeds this threshold. Range [0,10000]. 0 means no storm warning

items.description: Items with labels. as prefix are labels, otherwise attributes, such as title, severity, description, etc.

i_keys.description: Intelligent aggregation field list for similarity calculation. Defaults to calculate by four fields: title, description, labels.service, labels.resource if not provided

i_score_threshold.description: Intelligent aggregation similarity threshold, alerts can only be aggregated into incident when similarity between alert and incident exceeds this value

items.description: Single storm threshold, when incident aggregated alert count exceeds this threshold, system will issue storm warning.

storm_thresholds.description: Storm threshold list, empty means no storm warning.

if.description: Match condition, only when alert meets this condition, will equal items judgment be performed

equals.description: Equal items list, can select attribute and label fields, when all equal item field values are identical between two alerts, they are considered similar alerts

is_disabled.description: Whether disabled. true Disabled, false Enabled, default value false

max_changes.description: Maximum occurrence count of same incident within time window. Range [2,100], default value 4. When dedup_key is same, incidents are considered same. dedup_key comes from alert_key of first merged alert

in_mins.description: Statistics time window, in minutes. Range [1,1440], default value 60

mute_mins.description: Silence time window, in minutes. Range [0,1440], default value 120. If set to 0, means no silencing of subsequently triggered incidents

shedule_shift_notify.title: Notification method when shift change triggers

assigned_at.description: Assignment timestamp, in seconds. If actively acknowledged, acknowledgment time equals assignment time

acknowledged_at.description: Acknowledgment timestamp, in seconds. 0 means this personnel has not yet acknowledged incident

created_at.description: Operation time timestamp, note in milliseconds

detail.description: Operation details. Each type corresponds to different content, parse according to operation type

person_ids.description: (Direct assignment) Personnel ID list, choose one between this and escalate_rule_id

escalate_rule_id.description: (Rule assignment) Escalation rule ID, when exists, choose one between this and person_ids

layer_idx.description: (Rule assignment) Current assignment level, when using rule assignment, can specify the assignment level, e.g. directly escalate to second level

notify.description: Current assignment notification configuration (currently only supports direct message and template specification), can be used for both direct and rule assignment.

layer_person_reset.description: (Rule assignment) Level personnel replacement, when using rule assignment, can set personnel for different levels simultaneously, key is level index starting from 0. Only for special scenarios, you can ignore

layer_webhook_reset.description: (Rule assignment) Level Webhook replacement, when using rule assignment, can set Webhooks for different levels simultaneously, key is level index starting from 0. Only for special scenarios, you can ignore

emails.description: (Direct assignment) Personnel email list, can use this value instead of person_ids, equivalent to direct assignment. Only for special scenarios, you can ignore

follow_preference.description: Follow personal preference, defaults to true

personal_channels.description: Personal notification channel, effective when follow_preference=false

template_id.description: Template ID, defaults to "Default Template" for direct assignment; defaults to template specified in escalation rule for rule assignment

options.title: Optional values
options.description: Array elements cannot be duplicate, and type must conform to value_type definition

default_value.title: Default value
default_value.description: Type must conform to value_type definition

advance_in_time.title: How long in advance to notify

cycle.title: day
cycle.description: Currently only daily granularity is supported

start.description: Format: 08:00. Only effective when both cycle and start have data
start.title: Start Time

team_id.title: Management team ID, if 0, only creator and owner can modify configuration

timezone.title: Calendar timezone, format requirement: must conform to IANA Time Zone Database timezone definition

workdays.title: Workday list
workdays.description: This item is empty for public holiday calendar

extra_cal_ids.title: Associated other calendar ID list, e.g. Mainland China legal holidays
extra_cal_ids.description: This item is empty for public holiday calendar

creator_id.title: Creator ID
creator_id.description: This item is 0 for public holiday calendar

updated_by.title: Updater ID
updated_by.description: This item is 0 for public holiday calendar

creator_id.title: Creator ID
creator_id.description: May be empty for public holidays

search_after_ctx.description: Cursor pagination, defaults to first page if not set. Choose one between this and p parameter. For detailed explanation, see [About Pagination](https://developer.flashcat.cloud/doc-3502603)

p.description: Traditional pagination, starts from first page if not set, default value is 1, choose one between this and search_after_ctx parameter. When using traditional pagination, p*limit must not exceed 10000, otherwise parameter error is returned. For detailed explanation, see [About Pagination](https://developer.flashcat.cloud/doc-3502603)

limit.description: Page size. When p parameter is set, (p-1)*limit must not exceed 10000, otherwise parameter error is returned. For detailed explanation, see [About Pagination](https://developer.flashcat.cloud/doc-3502603)

search_after_ctx.description: Cursor pagination, presence of this item indicates next page exists. For detailed explanation, see [About Pagination](https://developer.flashcat.cloud/doc-3502603)

total.description: Total matched count. Note that total is only accurate when less than 1000. Do not use this value to determine if pagination is complete. When total count exceeds 1000, system only returns total=1000, indicating 1000+ data matched. Use hax_next_page to determine if more data exists. For detailed explanation, see [About Pagination](https://developer.flashcat.cloud/doc-3502603)

kind.title: Rule type
kind.description: Rules will be executed in order

if.title: Filter conditions, empty represents match all

pattern.title: Extract regex
pattern.description: Must be valid regex; at least one self-match, if multiple substrings matched, join with space; only one of pattern or g_json can exist

g_json.title: gjson path
g_json.description: JSON path syntax, see [gjson.dev](https://gjson.dev) for specific syntax; note only one of g_json or pattern can exist

override.title: Whether to override if result label already exists

template.title: Composition rule
template.description: A format string, allows setting variables, variable name like ${label}, label is source label name

override.title: Whether to override if result label already exists

result_labels.title: Result label list
result_labels.description: Must be result field defined in mapping table

override.title: Whether to override if result label already exists

cases.title: Conditional routing
cases.description: At least one of conditional routing or default routing must exist

sections.description: Section position starting from 0, 0 represents placing before case 0

default.title: Default routing
default.description: At least one of default routing or conditional routing must exist

channel_ids.description: Required when routing_mode is standard, cannot fill when name mapping mode

name_mapping_label.description: Mapping key in labels field, value of this key is channel name, e.g. labels.ChannelName

detail.title: Operation details
detail.description: Each type corresponds to different content, parse according to operation type

kind.title: Rule type
kind.description: Rules will be executed in order

if.title: Filter conditions, empty represents match all

anyOf.title: Filter conditions, empty represents match all

settings.title: Rule configuration
settings.description: Different rule types have different configurations

title.title: New alert title
title.description: Supports generation through variables, see [Customize Incident Title](https://docs.flashcat.cloud/zh/flashduty/customize-incident-attrs)

description.title: New alert description
description.description: Supports generation through variables, see [Customize Incident Description](https://docs.flashcat.cloud/zh/flashduty/customize-incident-attrs)

severity.title: New severity
severity.description: Supports generation through variables, see [Customize Incident Description](https://docs.flashcat.cloud/zh/flashduty/customize-incident-attrs)

source_filters.title: Active alert match condition
source_filters.description: Supports label, title, severity and other match conditions, does not support label CIDR matching. Note this match condition is different from incident inhibit rule, only supports one group of AND conditions, does not support multiple groups of OR conditions

equals.description: Items starting with label. are label items, others are attribute items
equals.title: Equal items

start_time.title: Start Time
start_time.description: Second timestamp, incident trigger time must be greater than this time

end_time.title: End Time
end_time.description: Second timestamp, incident trigger time must be less than or equal to this time. Maximum time span 6 months, if aggregate_unit granularity is day, maximum time span is 6 months

team_ids.title: Team List
team_ids.description: Team list, take intersection when passed together with is_my_team

is_my_team.title: My teams
is_my_team.description: Take intersection when passed together with team_ids

channel_ids.title: Channel List
channel_ids.description: Channel list, can only select channels visible to you

time_zone.title: Timezone
time_zone.description: Default timezone Asia/Shanghai, timezone for results and grouping. Must be in tzdata format. See [here](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones) for acceptable values list

labels.title: Incident labels
labels.description: One or more incident labels represented as key-value pairs, exact match

fields.title: Custom fields
fields.description: One or more custom fields represented as key-value pairs, only supports data filtering based on non-text type custom fields. Exact match

seconds_to_close_from.title: Minimum alive time
seconds_to_close_from.description: When passing non-zero value, filter incidents with alive time greater than or equal to this value, does not support filtering for personal dimension metrics

seconds_to_close_to.title: Maximum alive time
seconds_to_close_to.description: When passing non-zero value, filter incidents with alive time less than this value, does not support filtering for personal dimension metrics

seconds_to_ack_from.title: Minimum acknowledgment time
seconds_to_ack_from.description: When passing non-zero value, filter incidents with acknowledgment time greater than or equal to this value

seconds_to_ack_to.title: Maximum acknowledgment time
seconds_to_ack_to.description: When passing non-zero value, filter incidents with acknowledgment time less than this value

total_engaged_seconds.description: Total time spent by responders participating in incident handling. One person's handling time is the time difference from acknowledgment to incident closure (close_time-ack_time), may include snooze time. If no one acknowledges, this value is 0.
total_engaged_seconds.title: Total responder response time

total_notifications.title: Total notifications
total_notifications.description: Count assignment notifications from all channels

total_interruptions.title: Total interruptions
total_interruptions.description: Only count assignment notifications from SMS, voice, and APP push channels. Multi-channel simultaneous push to one responder counts as one interruption, if less than 1 minute from last notification, does not count as interruption. e.g.: incident assigned at 10:00, continuous notifications for next 5 minutes only count as one interruption

ts.title: Phase start time
ts.description: Second timestamp, whether to display depends on whether data is aggregated by time granularity. If aggregate_unit is day, this value will be determined as midnight timestamp of the day according to time_zone

hours.title: Time type
hours.description: Define each hour as one of work time, rest time, or sleep time. To distinguish metric differences under different time periods. This field is not displayed when time period filtering is not performed. An incident's time type only depends on its occurrence time, even if the incident alive time spans multiple time types, it will not be split.

channel_id.title: Channel ID
channel_id.description: Channel ID, grouped data, may or may not exist based on grouping

channel_name.title: Channel Name
channel_name.description: Channel name, grouped data, may or may not exist based on grouping

team_id.title: Team ID
team_id.description: Team ID, grouped data, may or may not exist based on grouping

team_name.title: Team Name
team_name.description: Team name, grouped data, may or may not exist based on grouping

total_incidents_reassigned.description: Total reassigned incident count, only count incidents assigned to this responder but then transferred to others
total_incidents_reassigned.title: Reassigned incident count

total_incidents_escalated.title: Escalated incident count
total_incidents_escalated.description: Total escalated incident count, only count incidents assigned to this responder but then escalated to others

total_incidents_manually_escalated.title: Manually escalated incident count
total_incidents_manually_escalated.description: Total count of incidents manually escalated by responder to others excluding themselves

total_incidents_timeout_escalated.title: Auto-escalated incident count
total_incidents_timeout_escalated.description: Total count of incidents auto-escalated to others excluding current responder

total_notifications.title: Total notifications
total_notifications.description: Count total assignment notifications from all channels

total_interruptions.title: Total interruptions
total_interruptions.description: Only count assignment notifications from SMS, voice, and APP push channels. Multi-channel simultaneous push to one responder counts as one interruption, if less than 1 minute from last notification, does not count as interruption. e.g.: incident assigned at 10:00, continuous notifications for next 5 minutes only count as one interruption

total_engaged_seconds.description: Total time spent by responders participating in incident handling. One person's handling time is the time difference from acknowledgment to incident closure (close_time-ack_time), may include snooze time. If no one acknowledges, this value is 0.
total_engaged_seconds.title: Total response effort time

ts.title: Time period start time
ts.description: Second timestamp, whether to display depends on whether data is aggregated by time granularity. If aggregate_unit is day, this value will be determined as midnight timestamp of the day according to time_zone

hours.title: Time type
hours.description: Define each hour as one of work time, rest time, or sleep time. To distinguish metric differences under different time periods. This field is not displayed when time period filtering is not performed. An incident's time type only depends on its occurrence time, even if the incident alive time spans multiple time types, it will not be split.

phone.description: Phone number, middle digits are masked

account_role_ids.description: Role ID list, empty means no role assigned

time_zone.description: Default timezone, must be in tzdata format. See [here](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones) for acceptable values list.

ref_id.description: Reference ID, used for third-party sync to identify account, e.g. Nightingale user ID

cases.title: Conditional routing
cases.description: At least one of conditional routing or default routing must exist

default.title: Default routing
default.description: At least one of default routing or conditional routing must exist

anyOf.description: Attributes, supports alert title, description, severity

aggregate_unit.title: Aggregation granularity
aggregate_unit.description: Time unit for aggregating metrics. If no value is provided, metrics for the entire period will be aggregated.

split_hours.title: Whether to distinguish time periods
split_hours.description: Whether to aggregate metrics by work time, rest time, and sleep time, commonly used for scenarios with different response SLA requirements for different time periods

items.description: Personnel ID, can be account_id or member_id

ref_id.description: Reference ID, used for third-party sync identification, e.g. Nightingale team ID

key.description: Key secret, list will not return this information, you can get information in create API or details API

share_link.description: Share link, if exists, can click link to join group chat

src.description: Image source, publicly accessible image link starting with http/https or image_key returned by image upload interface

position.description: Section position starting from 0, 0 represents placing before case 0
position.title: Position

url.description: URL, access address, length limit 500 characters

headers.description: Headers, Accept, Authorization, User-Agent whitelist, others not allowed for now

DutyError.description: Error message, only exists on failure
